Authors: Eugene Yurchenko, Janett Riebesehl, Ewald Langer
Title:
Clarification of Lyomyces sambuci complex with the
descriptions of four new species
Keywords:
bamboo, Mascarene Archipelago, Schizoporaceae, tropics,
wood decay fungi
Abstract:
Four species of Lyomyces (Hymenochaetales, Basidiomycota)
are described as new for science, based on collections from RÃ©union
Island (L. allantosporus and L. mascarensis), southeast Brazil
(L.organensis), and Taiwan (L. orientalis). All four species belong to
the L. sambuci complex and grow on dead wood. Basidiomata photographs
and line drawings of microstructures are provided for each species. The
specific status of the new taxa was confirmed by ITS and 28S
phylogenetical analyses. The concept of L. sambuci s. str. is discussed.
Molecular data reveal one additional cryptic species from Europe,
morphologically identical with L. sambuci s. str.
